vulnerabilities.product: Remote Support (RS) and Privileged Remote Access (PRA)
vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: BeyondTrust Remote Support (RS) and Privileged Remote Access (PRA) OS Command Injection Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: BeyondTrust Remote Support (RS) and Privileged Remote Access (PRA)contain an OS command injection vulnerability. Successful exploitation could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute operating system commands in the context of the site user. Successful exploitation requires no authentication or user interaction and may lead to system compromise, including unauthorized access, data exfiltration, and service disruption.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.
vulnerabilities.notes: Please adhere to the vendor's guidelines to assess exposure and mitigate risks. Check for signs of potential compromise on all internet accessible BeyondTrust products affected by this vulnerability. For more information please: see: https://www.beyondtrust.com/trust-center/security-advisories/bt26-02 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2026-1731

vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Apple iOS, macOS, tvOS, watchOS, and visionOS contain an improper restriction of operations within the bounds of a memory buffer vulnerability that could allow an attacker with memory write the capability to execute arbitrary code.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Configuration Manager SQL Injection Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Microsoft Configuration Manager contains an SQL injection vulnerability. An unauthenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending specially crafted requests to the target environment which are processed in an unsafe manner enabling the attacker to execute commands on the server and/or underlying database.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: Notepad++ Download of Code Without Integrity Check Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Notepad++ when using the WinGUp updater, contains a download of code without integrity check vulnerability that could allow an attacker to intercept or redirect update traffic to download and execute an attacker-controlled installer. This could lead to arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the user.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: SolarWinds Web Help Desk Security Control Bypass Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: SolarWinds Web Help Desk contains a security control bypass vulnerability that could allow an unauthenticated attacker to gain access to certain restricted functionality.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft MSHTML Framework Protection Mechanism Failure Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Microsoft MSHTML Framework contains a protection mechanism failure vulnerability that could allow an unauthorized attacker to bypass a security feature over a network.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Windows NULL Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Microsoft Windows Remote Access Connection Manager contains a NULL pointer dereference that could allow an unauthorized attacker to deny service locally.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Windows Shell Protection Mechanism Failure Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Microsoft Windows Shell contains a protection mechanism failure vulnerability that could allow an unauthorized attacker to bypass a security feature over a network.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Windows Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Services contains an improper privilege management vulnerability that could allow an authorized attacker to elevate privileges locally.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

vulnerabilities.shortDescription: Microsoft Desktop Windows Manager contains a type confusion vulnerability that could allow an authorized attacker to elevate privileges locally.
vulnerabilities.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.
